data.title: The food is not bad
data.text:
I had lunch here this week. The boring name is a good fit for this little Chinese place. We decided the food was "okay," a slim notch above "not bad." Looking for positive things to say we found that it is convenient for the Law School corner of campus and the prices are good. I love pot stickers. Theirs were wondrously boring. The fried tofu was bland even with sauce. But you can try a small range of their food at the lunch buffet.

This is NOT a place to take a first date if you want a second date. There is absolutely nothing fancy or attractive here. On the other hand, when you have been dating for a year and want to eat together without impressing or busting the wallet, this may be a decent choice. But with so much to choose from in the area I would only return for variety.

Perhaps if I loved bubbles in my tea I would have become a fan. Perhaps.

data.title: Best Asian Food in town
data.text: Very authentic asian food that is also cheap. The portion sizes are huge and well worth the money. I would recommend generals chicken, the spring rolls and pot stickers. I'm sure everything on their menu is great.

data.title: Buffet is pretty bad, takeout is good
data.text:
The lunch buffet just isn't all that good.  There is lots of good ethnic food in the neighborhood, so I'm just not sure why you would go there unless you are a law student with an insatiable desire for inordinate amounts of Americanized Chinese food.

I will say that the redeeming factor of this spot is its takeout, which is good, but not great and can get spicy!

data.title: Best Bubble Tea in Bloomington
data.text: The Chow Bar is across the street from the IU Law School. It has a huge menu. Their calamari is fantastic and the lunch buffet is reasonably priced. Try

data.title: yay for bubble tea!
data.text:
Chow Bar probably has the best bubble tea in b-town.
the restaurant is located right across from the law school. they also offer buffer for lunch. not sure about their food but bubble tea is certain the best!

data.title: This is the best chinese lunch buffet in Bloomington...AND IT'S CHEAP!
data.text: The lunch buffet is fantastical.  The location is convenient.  The staff tends to be awkwardly favoring the asian crowd in both service frequency and friendliness.  I've once sat through an entire meal with an empty glass of water and when the waiter finally noticed, he literally poured an inch of water into the glass and walked away.  Don't let this review scare you away, it's a good place to eat way too much chinese food.

data.title: Enjoy it's lunch buffet!
data.text:
I enjoy its lunch buffet. Not all the offerings are great but there are some very tasty ones.
Certainly, a great value for the buck!

data.title: Like home!
data.text: The boss is my friend, she is a sweet old lady and always treat me free food  by her own cooking. When me or any of my friends have birthday party in her restaurant she give us discount. By the way, they make the best bubble tea in Bloomington!
